revised_title: The Influence of Stress and Strain on the Action of Physical Forces
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to understand the influence of stress and strain on the action of physical forces in various metals. They found that the electrical resistance of metals can be temporarily altered by longitudinal stress, and that permanent extension can affect the temporary alteration of resistance. The study also revealed that stress applied in a direction transverse to the current can produce alterations in resistance opposite to those resulting from longitudinal traction.
